snippet: At least 11 deaths were attributed to the storm, but it did not seem to be a catastrophe that would disrupt the coastlines of Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas for months....
abstract: Communities in Florida, Georgia and Carolinas cope with aftermath of Hurricane Matthew; officials and residents express relief that storm, which caused mass evacuations, severe flooding and extensive power loss, claimed just 11 lives.

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ, ALAN BLINDER and JESS BIDGOOD
byline.contributor: Lizette Alvarez reported from St. Augustine, Alan Blinder from Orlando, Fla., and Jess Bidgood from Charleston, S.C. Reporting was contributed by Nick Madigan from Miami; Les Neuhaus from Jacksonville Beach, Fla.; Richard Pérez-Peña from New York; Frances Robles from Jacksonville, Fla.; and Campbell Robertson from Statesboro, Ga.

lead_paragraph: At least 11 deaths were attributed to the storm, but it did not seem to be a catastrophe that would disrupt the coastlines of Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas for months.

headline.main: A Weakened Hurricane Matthew Still Delivers Flooding and Power Failures
headline.print_headline: A Weakened Hurricane Still Delivers Heavy Flooding and Power Failures
